description.narrative: Technical Support to the Department of Planning, Government of Punjab to establish SDG Coordination Centre (SDGCC) for facilitating implementation of Punjab SDG Vision 2030

activity-description.narrative: Support to the Government of Punjab to establish the Sustainable Development Goals Coordination Centre

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

comment.narrative: 1. State indicators to align themselves with the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI) SDG monitoring framework 2. Develop district level data collection tool 3. Finalize SDG monitoring framework matrix 4. Establish SDG dashboard 5. Finalize SDG Technology Interventions report 6. Finalize Policy and Governance Reform report 7. Finalize SDG Resource Gap report

1. Draft SDG State indicator framework aligned with MoSPI monitoring framework developed 2. District cell established in one district (Patiala) - data collection tool development is in progress 3. Department wise SDGs monitoring framework developed and shared with concerned departments. Consultations with nodal officers for data management is planned. 4. Development of SDG Dashboard is in progress 5. Report is in progress - it will be finalized by March, 2021 6. Preliminary consultations with departments undertaken and first draft submitted to state government 7. Concept note developed and shared with Department of Panning
1. Establish SDG Coordination Centre in Punjab 2. Complete recruitment of project management staff
1. SDG Coordination Centre established in Punjab for fast tracking implementation of SDGs in the state 2. Recruitment of project staff completed and project management unit established

1 Innovative SDG hope Calendar mobile App 2 Website developed for SDGCC Punjab 3 To hire Social media and design creation agency 4 Exhibition for legislators 5 Campaign with youth for SDG awareness 6 SDG Action Awards 2021 to recognize innovations in Punjab 7 SDG conclave 8 Hiring consultant for development of innovative e-awareness solutions and maintenance of existing systems 9 Event for journalists and workshops with radio channels 10 e-module for awareness developed 11 SDG Action Plan 2030 12 Documenting best practices 13 Policy paper on integrated planning for implementation of selected schemes/programmes 14 Output-Outcome framework developed 15 Development of SDG District Action Plan 16 Development e-module on fundamental of SDG localization 17 Development of district SDG Index report 18 Constitution of SDG cell in all districts 19 Develop district resource person pool on SDGs 20 Undertake household data compilation (multi-dimensional poverty index) in five identified villages 21 Recommendation of policy and plans for the district administration of the identified five villages 22 Launch a platform for Academic institutions engagement in the state 23 Launch a platform for Private sector engagement in Punjab to ensure sustainability in business, financial mobilization, and physical support in the state 24 Expand (Integrated Innovative Inclusive Ideas Incubator i.e. i4SDGs) project in District Patiala 25 Forge partnerships with private sector entities, CSR entities, development agencies, etc. 26 Finalize the Resource Gap Report 27 State index framework (SIF) developed 28 Innovative first of its kind SDG dashboard helping in policy intervention in the state 29 SDG dashboard operationalize at departmental level 30 SDG dashboard operationalize at district level 31 Capacity building exercise on SDG indicators/dashboard through various tutorials

1. Innovative SDG hope Calendar mobile App - Completed 2. Website developed for SDGCC Punjab - Completed 3. To hire Social media and design creation agency - Completed 4. Exhibition for legislators - Given the political situation in the state, the activity will need to be shifted to 2022. 5. Campaign with youth for SDG awareness - Completed 6. SDG Action Awards 2021 to recognize innovations in Punjab - Completed 7. Hiring consultant for development of innovative e-awareness solutions and maintenance of existing systems - Modules developed by Delhi Office are being assessed for their adaptation to Punjab. 8. Event for journalists and workshops with radio channels - One virtual a workshop with RJs was conducted in 2020. Next set of workshops will be scheduled in 2022. 9. e-module for awareness developed - In process. Modules developed by Delhi Office are being assessed for their adaptation to Punjab. 10. SDG Action Plan 2030 – in process 11. Documenting best practices – completed 12. SDG conclave - Consultation on SDG 2-Zero Hunger, SDG 3-Good Health & Wellbeing, SDG 5-Gender Equality, SDG 4-Quality Education, SDG 13-Climate Action held and for others in Process. 13. Policy paper on integrated planning for implementation of selected schemes/programmes - Some proposals were submitted but approval is awaited. 14. Output-Outcome framework developed - Output-Outcome framework development on pilot basis was done for 3 Departments. 15. As per the decision of the State, Output-Outcome framework based on Budget of FY 2022-23 will be undertaken 16. Development of SDG District Action Plan - In Process 17. Completed the Chapter on SDGs (2) Zero Hunger, (3) Good Health and Well-being, (4) Quality Education, (5) Gender Equality, (6) Clean Water and Sanitation, (7) Affordable and Clean Energy, (8) Decent Work and Economic Growth, (9) Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure, (13) Climate Action, (15) Life On Land- In process for the SDGs (10) Reducing Inequality, (11) Sustainable Cities and Communities, (12) Responsible Consumption and Production, (16) Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions 18. Constitution of SDG Cell in all districts • Department of planning, Government of Punjab has approved for constitution of District SDG Cell in three Districts of Punjab (Fatehgarh Sahib, Rupnagar and SAS Nagar) and sent letter to 3 District Administration for Constitution of District SDG Cell. • 2. District Administration Rupnagar has notified District SDG Cell 19. Develop District Resource Persons Pool on SDGs • Implementation plan for linking SDGs with GPDP has been prepared and discussed with RDP regarding District Resource Persons Pool and other localization activities. • 2. Awaiting response from RDP. 20. District SDG Index Report • District SDG Index of Punjab prepared comprising of 107 indicators. • 2. Document shared with ESO and Department of Planning, Government of Punjab for their approval and further necessary action. 21. District Four Years Action Plan • District Four Years Action Plan of Patiala developed and presently reviewing action plan of 9 Departments on monthly basis. • Working with 9 District Departments and supporting them in developing and tracking their monthly plan • 3. District SDG Cell review meeting held to discuss progress of identified activities in the District 22. Creation of SDG Model Panchayat • Review meeting held with Panchayat Secretaries of five identified villages regarding implementation of GPDP • Activities are being implemented in five identified villages • 3. Documented case studies from five identified villages on implementation of GPDP activities 23. SDG Localization Manual for PRI members • Design of both English and Gurumukhi Manual and Brochure are ready. • 2. Awaiting final date for launch from RDP 24. Launch a platform for Academic institutions engagement in the state - Academia Conclave concluded; Academia SDG Mapping Report finalized. Academia Engagement platform not yet initiatied (PoA - Organize a round table with key academic institutions to finalize the framework for engagemnet platform) 25. Launch a platform for Private sector engagement in Punjab to ensure sustainability in business, financial mobilization, and physical support in the state - In response to CMO query, it has been advised that Punjab can adapt the Akanksha platform as per State’s needs and requirements. A note has been put up in this regard; demo to be organized soon. (AKANKSHA is an SDG Financing matchmaking platform that has been developed by UNDP SDGCC Karnataka for the state government. It supports and facilitates collaborations with private sector/NGOs/ Multilaterals / Line Departments of the Government, thus achieving sustainable and holistic development of the State. 26. Expand (Integrated Innovative Inclusive Ideas Incubator i.e. i4SDGs) project in District Patiala - Completed 27. Forge partnerships with private sector entities, CSR entities, development agencies, etc. - Multiple proposals as per requirements and needs of the state government have been prepared and shared with potential donors/partner. Some projects completed - GEET, COVID study, air pollution pilot, etc. Others are still being discussed. In this context, SDGCC Punjab has proposed a Pvt. Sector Conclave in partnership with FICCI to mobilize support from industrial entities in the region - file already put up to Planning Dept. 28. Finalize the Resource Gap Report - This was discussed with Principal Secretary, Department of Planning and will be initiated soon 29. State index framework (SIF) developed - Completed 30. Innovative first of its kind SDG dashboard helping in policy intervention in the state - completed 31. SDG dashboards operationalize at district level, departmental level and Capacity building exercise on SDG indicators/dashboard through various tutorials is in process.

1. Ensure SDGCC is up and running and each of the five components has an established team and clear work plan for the year 2. Build awareness and capacity of all stakeholders around SDG VISION of Punjab and its targets 3. Identify integrated development solutions and innovations to accelerate SDG implementation; institutional mechanisms and policy changes to improve coordination and leverage disruptive technologies and digital governance solutions to improve service delivery 4. Adapt SDG VISION for local district level and GP level authorities in their plans and processes 5. Establish plans and systems to mobilize partners and resources to meet the estimated needs for human, financial and physical resources 6. Technology-based tools to monitor SDGs developed and M & E systems strengthened to track SDGs targets set in SDG VISION 2030 document
